 They say she was doing cartwheels in the police station before being questioned. In my opinion, that could mean she was high on something, had no inkling that she would ever be considered a suspect which speaks to a sense of innocence on her part, or she is just crazy, but in no way does it reflect any type of sense of guilt on her part at all. People are supposed to be convicted on evidence, not perceptions of guilt based on popularity or even likability.
